results.title: Sleep with the fishes
results.brief_description: In this parody of every film noir film ever made, a lowly flamingo who has crossed the mob is outfitted with concrete booties and desptached to join other such ornamental totems.

results.title: Blue
results.brief_description: Travellers crossing a post-apolcalyptic landscape unearth a time capsule containing the accumulated wealth and knowledge of a now extinct society (ours). They are now faced with a cruel dilemma: should they study this ancient civilization or simply consume its last remaining treasures?

results.title: Octikuki
results.brief_description: Octikuki uses 2D and 3D computer animation to create a futuristic creation scene. The animation plays with themes nature and science reading as a visual poem. The music soundtrack ‘Sweet Thunder’ is by Yello.

results.title: Pharmaceutical girl
results.creator_credit: Dik Jarman, David Atkinson and Jeremy Parker
results.brief_description: ‘Pharmaceutical girl’ is not strictly a claymation. The creator Dik Jarman with Nick Pledge set about experimenting with an alternate type of puppet. Pledge created an internal armitage complete with moving joints and rising chest cavity, whilst Jarman designed and sculpted the puppet using an alternate latex type of skin to form the flesh of the puppet. A surreal animation that takes us on the journey of Sukei and her addiction. Dealt mostly with symbolism, the pricks of the rose replace the syringe. The set (of which Jarman won an award for) is both functional for the purpose of shooting scenes with moveable walls etc, but also represents Sukei’s mind as the greater part of the set makes up the internals of a clock. As she begins to hallucinate the clock-like set begins to grind to a halt and then into reverse, Sukei’s dream takes over. What initially begins as peaceful escape quickly turns into a nightmare. (The soundtrack is by Edwina Blush and Thierry Cotco Lovett).

results.title: The Joker to the thief
results.brief_description: A surreal hand-drawn computer animation of a thief who steals his way into a mediaeval castle. Filled with hallucenogenic imagery the thief is surrounded by magic, scenes of madness and other horrors. He attempts to flee but is followed by the joker equipped with his tricks.

results.title: Flare
results.brief_description: Using a mixture of 2D computer animation styles influenced my Manga films, Flare is surreal with images of insects seen through the microscrope, metaphorically illustrating the obsessions and world of a dedicated scientist. The scientist is confronted by his daughter who insists he talk with her about family issues of the past. The father ignores his daughters request and chooses to bury himself in his work.

results.title: La Maison des Cochons
results.creator_credit: David Harris, Matt Tumbers and Minty
results.brief_description: A claymation about an unsuspecting man whose fondness for baby pork is tantalised when he passes a restaurant that specialises in pig dishes. He is charmed and impressed by the service and ambience of the restaurant as he places his order with the waiter. The gruesome truth of the restaurant is soon revealed to the man when his dish arrives.

results.title: Deeth treo
results.brief_description: A surreal cut-out animation of a lone horse seen travelling the desert with a mortally wounded knight strapped to his back. The horse in collusion with the tree delivers the corpse to sate the tree’s canabalistic desires. A black comedy.
